newsitem.title: USA: US and European steel groups applaud trade talks.
newsitem.headline: US and European steel groups applaud trade talks.

text.p: The Specialty Steel Industry of North America and the European Confederation of Iron and Steel Industries said Sunday they support continuing talks between the European Commission and the United States over improving trade.

The groups said they are pleased that both the European Commission and the United States are again moving forward with detailed discussions on an agreement which the groups say would "directly contribute" to free and fair trade in specialty steel worldwide by banning subsidies amd removing trade barriers.

In March, the groups, which represent makers of high-tech steel products for tools and other products, jointly announced their proposals for a multilateral agreement. At that time, the US and EC agreed to conduct bilateral talks on the matter, the groups said.
The Specialty Steel Industry of North America, with headquarters in Washington, said it represents most of the nation's stainless steel and alloy tool steels producers.
The European Confederation is a Brussels-based group representing 90 percent of the European Union's crude steel production and all specialty steel producers.
